page.title: 18Education in Middleton
page.content:
The village school which opened in 1876 closed in the 1970's to become the village hall (held on a token rent from the estate and managed by a committee). At present there are 18 children of schoolage who mostly attend either the Junior School in Youlgreave or Lady Manners Comprehensive School in Bakewell. Four young people are studying at Universities or Colleges.
From time to time adult evening classes are held in the village hall under a scheme organised by Lady Manners School Community Centre.
